title: Italvolt chooses the former Olivetti area of Scarmagno to build Italy’s first Gigafactory – Italvolt
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Scarmagno, Italy, in the Olivetti industrial area.

Capacity:
- The initial capacity of the Gigafactory is 45 GWh, with a plan to increase to meet the expected demand of 3,600 GWh by 2030.

Investment amounts:
- The overall investment for the first stage of the project is approximately 4 billion Euros.

Project progress:
- The project is in the initial stage and is expected to be completed by Spring of 2024. The site selection, design, and planning are underway.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the construction of a Gigafactory from scratch.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

title: Strategic advancement of Italvolt's 45 GWh Gigafactory – Italvolt
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in the municipality of Scarmagno, in the Piedmont region of Italy.

Capacity:
- The planned production capacity of the gigafactory is 45 GWh when fully operational.

Investment amounts:
- The total investment for the project is approximately EUR 3.4 billion.

Project progress:
- Italvolt has signed a binding agreement with Prelios Sgr for the purchase of a 1 million m2 area in Scarmagno. The next step is to obtain building permits, expected by early 2022, with construction to begin in the second half of the year.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new gigafactory for the production and storage of lithium-ion batteries for electric vehicles.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

Note: The project is expected to contribute to the acceleration of battery production to support the transition to a zero-emission automotive industry by 2035.

title: Italvolt signs Memorandum of Understanding for the Gigafactory of Scarmagno and Romano Canavese – Italvolt
notes:
Location:
The battery production project, known as the Italvolt Gigafactory, is located in Scarmagno and Romano Canavese, in the Piedmont Region of Italy.

Capacity:
The project plans to start the production of lithium-ion batteries in the second half of 2024, with an expected production capacity of 45 GWh. It is expected to employ up to 3,000 employees.

Investment amounts:
The specific capital invested in the project is not mentioned in the provided information. However, talks have been intensified with the Ministry of Economic Development and other competent Ministries to identify support and financing measures for the project, including those provided by the PNRR (National Recovery and Resilience Plan).

Project progress:
The project has progressed from the presentation of the preliminary project to obtaining authorization at the beginning of 2022. The signing of the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Piedmont Region, the Metropolitan City of Turin, and the municipalities of Scarmagno, Romano Canavese, and Ivrea marks a significant step in the project's realization. The project aims to start production by 2024.

Project type:
The project involves the construction of a new Gigafactory on the former Olivetti site in Scarmagno and Romano Canavese.

Value chain stages:
The information provided does not specify the specific stages of the battery production value chain that will be covered at the facility.

title: Italvolt signs land purchase to build southern Europe’s largest gigafactory as EV battery cell plant race heats up
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Scarmagno, in the Piedmont region in Italy's northwest. The site was a former Olivetti factory.

Capacity:
- Italvolt aims to reach a capacity of 45 gigawatt hours (GWh) per year at the site.

Investment amounts:
- The company expects to invest around €3.4 billion ($4 billion) in the project.

Project progress:
- Italvolt has agreed to purchase around 1 million sq.m of land from Prelios Sgr, manager of Fondo Monteverdi, at the site of the former Olivetti factory. The company expects to acquire building permits by the beginning of 2022, with construction scheduled to begin in the second half of the year. The gigafactory is set for completion in 2024.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new battery factory on the site of a former factory.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

Additional Information:
- Italvolt has received federal and local government support for the site but no funding. The company has partnered with Pininfarina's Architecture Division to design the plant. The site was selected due to its existing infrastructure and strategic geographical location for road and rail connections. The project aims to restore the local industrial heritage, create jobs, and contribute to environmental improvements.
